fields_of_interest: Competition, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, External Relations, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: The Hellenic Naval Academy follows all the active European  legislation framework which implemented by national, European and International law. Mainly in the maritime sector but affects also the land and air sectors. The Laboratory of Fuel and Lubricants is very active in research activities in all the transport modes in respect to its expertise in the evaluating, standardizing and examining the use of fuel (all kinds) and lubricants into the operational use.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions

European Sustainable Shipping Forum (ESSF) 
European External Action Service/ European Security and Defense College (EEAS/ESDC)
goals__remit: The Hellenic Naval Academy (HNA) is one of the oldest Military and Academic Higher Educational Institution of Greece which was established in November 24, 1845. Its’ role is well depicted through history. Education of the officers is the most important priority for HNA along with research, that is to maintain the exceptional tradition that have been achieved so far, as well as to introduce and to improve new methods and procedures into the operational educational, training and research scene.
relevant_communication:
The publications of the Fuel and Lubricants Laboratory can be found in the following public available addresses: 
Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.gr/citations?user=ohPkwyYAAAAJ&hl=el&oi=ao 
Orcid: http://orcid.org/0000-0003-2504-1151 
Publons: https://publons.com/author/477819/stamatios-kalligeros#profile 
ResearchGate: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Stamatis_Kalligeros 
 
Additionally, acting Technical Conveyor of National Quality Infrastructure System - Hellenic Organization for Standardization (NQIS - ELOT) Technical Committee for Fuels, Lubricants, Petrochemical Industry and related products from 2006. National Contact Point (NCP) for standardization of Fuels (liquid, air and solid) to European Organization for Standardization (CEN).
position: Assistant Professor, Director of Fuels & Lubricants Laboratory
